Sentencas: High oxygen permeability of mixed conductive La0.65Ca0.35FeO3-delta (LCF) is applicable to pure oxygen gas generators and cathodes for solid oxide fuel cells, etc.; however, lower surface exchange reactions at temperatures below 800 degrees C reduce permeability.
Titulo: Surface Exchange Reaction of Mixed Conductive La0.65Ca0.35FeO3-δ during Oxygen Evolution and Incorporation as Traced by Operando X-ray Photoelectron Spectroscopy

Sentencas: To understand the microscopic surface reaction mechanism, operando soft X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy of an LCF film surface was conducted during the evolution and incorporation of oxygen.
Titulo: Surface Exchange Reaction of Mixed Conductive La0.65Ca0.35FeO3-δ during Oxygen Evolution and Incorporation as Traced by Operando X-ray Photoelectron Spectroscopy

Sentencas: LCF film was prepared on yttria-stabilized zirconia and a current was applied throughout the film at similar to 600 degrees C. From operando X-ray photoelectron spectra, surface oxide species involved in the surface exchange reaction obviously appeared on the film during the evolution of oxygen from the surface.
Titulo: Surface Exchange Reaction of Mixed Conductive La0.65Ca0.35FeO3-δ during Oxygen Evolution and Incorporation as Traced by Operando X-ray Photoelectron Spectroscopy

Sentencas: The number of surface oxide species abruptly decreased during incorporation of oxygen.
Titulo: Surface Exchange Reaction of Mixed Conductive La0.65Ca0.35FeO3-δ during Oxygen Evolution and Incorporation as Traced by Operando X-ray Photoelectron Spectroscopy

Sentencas: By applying the current from a negative to positive value, the numbers of surface oxide species and ligand holes near Fe3+ ions on the surface both significantly increased.
Titulo: Surface Exchange Reaction of Mixed Conductive La0.65Ca0.35FeO3-δ during Oxygen Evolution and Incorporation as Traced by Operando X-ray Photoelectron Spectroscopy

Sentencas: The results infer that ligand holes in the Fe 3d-O 2p hybrid orbitals correspond to active reaction sites at which surface oxide species change to oxygen molecules.
Titulo: Surface Exchange Reaction of Mixed Conductive La0.65Ca0.35FeO3-δ during Oxygen Evolution and Incorporation as Traced by Operando X-ray Photoelectron Spectroscopy

Sentencas: Increasing the number of active reaction sites is key to improving oxygen evolution of mixed conductive oxides.
Titulo: Surface Exchange Reaction of Mixed Conductive La0.65Ca0.35FeO3-δ during Oxygen Evolution and Incorporation as Traced by Operando X-ray Photoelectron Spectroscopy
